caption:
This photograph provides an aerial view of an urban area with a striking focus on transportation infrastructure. The scene captures a dense arrangement of railway tracks, predominantly occupying the foreground and extending toward the center of the image. Multiple railway cars are positioned along these tracks, suggesting a major transport or logistics hub.

Adjacent to the railway area, there's a large body of water featuring several docks with boats, indicating the proximity to a significant waterway, possibly for commercial or industrial use. Towards the right, another set of railway tracks merges from a complex network, accompanied by adjacent roads filled with vehicles, showcasing a busy metropolitan vibe.

Surrounding this transportation-focused center are numerous high-rise buildings, potentially residential or office spaces, contributing to a densely populated urban environment. These buildings vary in height and architecture, reflecting a developed cityscape.

In the broader background, more of the city can be seen extending into the distance, interspersed with more structures that blend into a compact urban setting. The overall color tone of the photograph leans towards a slightly darker hue, possibly due to the time of day or the age of the photograph itself. This aerial snapshot captures the essence of a bustling urban area heavily equipped to handle masses of transportation and habitation.
title: The west side of Manhattan, New York.  The New York, New Jersey metropolitan region is one the most congested urban and industrial areas of the world.  It creates stress factors for the bight including air and water pollution, destruction of wetlands which are nurseries for marine life, coastal overdevelopment, and ocean dumping of municipal and industrial wastes
